intro: Sida rhombifolia var. canescens, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The species is adapted to arid environments and has a low-growing, sprawling habit.
